derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: from Sisal, the name of a port in Yucatán, Mexico

entry.tran: 波罗麻，剑麻(用生长于西印度群岛、南美和非洲的一种植物的叶子制成的纤维)
entry.def: Sisal is the fibre from the leaves of a plant that is grown in the West Indies, South America, and Africa. Sisal is used to make rope, cord, and mats.

means.word_mean: 1. a plant fiber used for making rope
2. Mexican or West Indian plant with large fleshy leaves yielding a stiff fiber used in e.g. rope
